title: Bug 113047: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab.
description: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, there is no listing of child nodes. This issue occurs when performing the following steps:
OB: When a new data set is created without an SQL statement, and the new data source has no database/table/column information, the child node listing does not appear when changing the data source for the data set in the data set editor page of the query tab. Additionally, even after closing and reopening the data set editor, the child node listing is still not displayed.
SR:
1. Create a new data set without an SQL statement.
2. Ensure that the new data source has no database/table/column information.
3. Open the data set editor page of the query tab.
4. Attempt to change the data source for the data set.
5. Observe that no child node listing is displayed.
6. Close the data set editor.
7. Reopen the data set editor.
8. Verify that the child node listing is still not visible when changing the data source for the data set.
